newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-HODGSON CONFIRMS EARLY EXIT FROM INTER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HODGSON CONFIRMS EARLY EXIT FROM INTER.

text.p: Englishman Roy Hodgson on Friday confirmed his decision to resign immediately as coach at beaten UEFA Cup finalists Internazionale Milan, club sources said.
They said Hodgson, who is moving to English club Blackburn next season, had informed Inter chairman Massimo Moratti that he was quitting with two games left in the serie A season.
Hogdson's place on the bench for Sunday's match at home to Napoli and the game at Bologna on June 1 will be taken by the club's goalkeeping coach, Luciano Castellani.
Those matches will be crucial to Inter's hopes of clinching second place and a European Cup berth.

Although Inter have had a successful season, reaching the UEFA Cup final and staying in the top flight in serie A, Hodgson has not enjoyed a happy relationship with fans, media and senior figures within the club.
On Wednesday night, fans pelted him with coins and cigarette lighters as he left the pitch after Inter lost the UEFA Cup final to German club Schalke in a penalty shoot-out at the San Siro stadium.
